Module promethium.lang
Package io.github.epi155.pm.lang

Interface Some<T>

Type Parameters:
T - value type
All Superinterfaces:
AnyError, AnyValue<T>, ChoiceContext<T>, Glitches, ItemStatus, ManyErrors
public interface Some<T> extends ManyErrors, AnyValue<T>
Utility interface for carrying many errors (and warnings) xor a value (and warnings)

The interface has two main static constructors 

      Some.of(T value);                               // final value (and no warnings)
      Some.failure(CustMsg ce, Object... argv);       // single error message
If at most an error is returned (and no warnings), the use of Hope is preferable.

Usually the interface is used through a builder which allows to accumulate many errors (warnings) 

      val bld = Some.<T>builder();
      bld.fault(CustMsg ce, Object... argv);      // add single error message
      bld.alert(CustMsg ce, Object... argv);      // add single warning message
      bld.capture(Throwable t);                   // add error from Exception
      bld.value(T value);                         // set final value
      Some<T> some = bld.build();
The outcome of the interface can be evaluated imperatively 
      if (some.completeWithoutErrors()) {
          T value = some.value();                           // final value
          Collection<Warning> warnings = some.alerts();     // warning collection
          // ... action on value and warnings
      } else {
          Collection<? extends Signal> errors = some.signals();     // errors/warings collection
          // ... action on errors (and warnings)
      }
or functionally 
      some
          .onSuccess((T v, Collection<Warning> w) -> { ... })         // ... action on value and warnings
          .onFailure((Collection<? extends Signal> e) -> { ... });    // ... action on errors (and warnings);

      R r = some.<R>mapTo(
          (v, w) -> ...R,        // function from value and warning to R
          e -> ...R);            // function from error/warning to R
If we know, from the start, that no warnings will be raised, or knowingly want to ignore the warnings, we can use the simpler form 
      some
          .onSuccess(v -> { ... })        // ... action on value (ignoring warnings)
          .onFailure(e -> { ... });       // ... action on errors (and warnings);

      R r = some.<R>mapTo(
          v -> ...R,          // function from value (ignoring warnings) to R
          e -> ...R);         // function from error/warning to R

    • map

      @NotNull <R> @NotNull Some<R> map(@NotNull @NotNull Function<? super T,? extends AnyValue<R>> fcn)
      Compose operator

      Some • AnyValue+ → Some

      The method allows to compose two Somes (or a Some and an Hope). Using an imperative outcome evaluation we would have 

            Some<A> sa = computeA();
      Some<B> sb;
      if (sa.completeWithoutErrors()) {
          sb = a2sb(sa.value());      // Some<B> a2sb(A value)
      } else {
          sb = Some.failure(sa);
      }
      The method simplifies it to 
            Some<B> kb = computeA().map(this::a2sb);
      in addition, the method also propagates any warnings
      Type Parameters:
      R - result type
      Parameters:
      fcn - transform value to result Some
      Returns:
      result Some instance, if this has errors, the transformation is not called and the result has the original error

    • mapOf

      @NotNull <R> @NotNull Some<R> mapOf(@NotNull @NotNull Function<? super T,? extends R> fcn)
      map value

      Some • value → Some

      Type Parameters:
      R - result type
      Parameters:
      fcn - mapping function
      Returns:
      Some instance with new value, if this has errors, the transformation is not called and the result has the original error; RuntimeException are caught as new error

    • peek

      @NotNull @NotNull Some<T> peek(@NotNull @NotNull Consumer<? super T> action)
      If there are no errors and the value is present, the action on the value is performed. In any case the initial class is returned.
      Parameters:
      action - action on value, executed if there are no errors
      Returns:
      original Some instance, with value/errors
